title: Petroglyph National Monument: Parks as Classrooms
body: Parks as Classrooms        Field Trips Teachers and students visit Petroglyph National Monument to join a park ranger on one of several guided programs. Boca Negra Canyon, Rinconada Canyon, Piedras Marcadas Canyon, and the Volcanoes Day Use Area are all available for an out of classroom educational experience. Educational programs are free and limited to 30 students per group. Adult chaperones are required.  All Field Trips     Traveling Trunks Invite a Park Ranger to visit your classroom and present an educational program. Subjects vary from the Ancestral Puebloan Lifestyle, Spanish Colonial Lifestyle, Desert Mammals, Pottery workshop, Geology and Early Railroads in New Mexico.  All Traveling Trunks     Curriculum Materials These easy-to-do lessons are designed so all teachers can use them in their classrooms. Topics range from Culture and Lifestyles of the Ancestral Puebloans, to Petroglyphs, Geology, and Spanish Influence in New Mexico. Each topic is structured to fit Social Studies, Science, and Art Subjects.  All Curriculum Materials
